review: I have two of these in my house and they serve their purpose very well.  I keep most of my media on my computer or NAS drives and feed it to my chromecasts via Plex Media Server(free).  Chromecast is lacking apps that AppleTV has, but I have both and they both serve different purposes in my house.  Neither device can do everything.  First one their wins, but then again, do they really want to.....I still own both which is good for everyone.  Chromecast gets better slowly, and hopefully more streams will become available, but for the price point, its tough to beat. Only thing preventing 5 stars is the that not everything can stream to it, but what can, works great.  Enjoy!

review: Works great.  Attached to an extra HDMI port on my TV, I can cast my Android phone screens to the TV, or any webpage from my chrome book.  Most apps have an icon that permits the phone app to be cast to the TV; however, there are a few apps that block the casting of video, such as nfl mobil.  It is great for viewing your  own photos and videos on full screen HD TV, or You Tube videos, etc.  If you do not have the Amazon TV App on your TV, then you can cast downloaded movies to the TV from your smart phone with no loss of fidelity.
